AttributeReference.description: Specify left side of AS2 message ID. Regular expression or '.*' is allowed.
Specify right side of AS2 message ID. Regular expression or '.*' is allowed.
Specify partner's AS2 ID. Regular expression or '.*' is allowed.
Specify own AS2 ID. Regular expression or '.*' is allowed.
Specify AS2 message subject. Regular expression or '.*' is allowed.
Select client authentication type.
Add partner certificates for authorizations.
Enable this option to mandatorily check the filename.
Enable this option to ensure that the AS2 message with the same Message ID is not being processed more than once.

AttributeReference.ErrorMessage: Enter a valid positive integer greater than 0.
AttributeReference.description: Specify the time(in minutes), for which the Message ID will be stored for duplicate check.
Select the response you want to send back, if a message with a duplicate Message ID is encountered.
Enable this option to ensure that the AS2 message with the same filename is not being processed more than once.

AttributeReference.ErrorMessage: Enter a valid positive integer greater than 0.
AttributeReference.description: Specify the time(in minutes), for which the filename will be stored for duplicate check.
Select the response you want to send back, if a message with a duplicate filename is encountered.
Enable this option to decrypt AS2 Message.
Specify private key alias to decrypt AS2 Message.
Enable this option to verify AS2 Message signature.
Specify public key alias to verify AS2 Message signature.
Specify private key alias to sign the MDN on partner's request.
Select MDN signature encoding type.
Select authentication type for asynchronous MDN.
Specify deployed user credential alias for basic authentication for asynchronous MDN.
Specify private key alias for client certificate authentication for asynchronous MDN.
Specify the time in milliseconds during which client has to accept asynchronous MDN, before the timeout occurs. Enter the value '0' if you want the client to wait indefinitely.
Specify partner's AS2 ID. Regular expression or '.*' is allowed.
Specify own AS2 ID. Regular expression or '.*' is allowed.
Select client authentication type.
Add partner certificates for authorizations.
Enable this option to verify AS2 MDN signature.
Specify public key alias to verify AS2 MDN signature.
Enable this option to verify Message Integrity Check(MIC) from AS2 MDN.

AttributeReference.ErrorMessage: Enter a valid address or header expression or property expression. E.g. https://example or http://example or ${header.url} or ${property.url}
AttributeReference.description: Specify partner's AS2 URL. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify regular expression to pick camel headers and add them as URL parameters.
Select authentication type for AS2 Message.
Specify deployed user credential alias for basic authentication for AS2 Message. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify private key alias for client certificate authentication for AS2 Message. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify the time in milliseconds during which client has to accept AS2 Message, before the timeout occurs. Enter the value '0' if you want the client to wait indefinitely.
Specify AS2 filename. If no filename is specified, default filename will be set to <Own AS2 ID>_File. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify left side of AS2 Message ID. Format of AS2 message ID is {<Left side>@<Right side>}. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify right side of AS2 Message ID. Format of AS2 message ID is {<Left side>@<Right side>}. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify own AS2 ID. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify partner's AS2 ID. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify AS2 Message subject. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify own email ID. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify content type of the outgoing message. For e.g. application/edi-x12. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify regular expression to pick camel headers and add them as AS2 custom headers.
Select AS2 Message encoding type.
Enable this option to compress AS2 Message.
Enable this option to sign AS2 Message.
Select AS2 Message signing algorithm.
Specify private key alias to Sign AS2 Message. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Enable this option to encrypt AS2 Message
Select AS2 Message encryption algorithm.
Specify public key alias to encrypt AS2 Message. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Specify public Key length.
Select MDN type which has to be requested from partner in outgoing AS2 Message.

AttributeReference.ErrorMessage: Enter a valid address or header expression or property expression. E.g. https://example or http://example or ${header.url} or ${property.url}
AttributeReference.description: Specify URL on which AS2 MDN will be received from partner. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Enable this option to request partner to sign AS2 MDN.
Select signing algorithm for the requested signed AS2 MDN.
Enable this option to verify AS2 MDN signature.
Specify public key alias to verify AS2 MDN signature. Use of simple expression, ${header.<header-name>} or ${property.<property-name>}, is allowed.
Enable this option to request partner to send Message Integrity Check(MIC) in AS2 MDN.
Enable this option to verify Message Integrity Check(MIC) from AS2 MDN.
